pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, July 15, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Montréal, Quebec

Private meetings.

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with youth leaders from Le Forum Jeunesse de Saint-Michel. Member of Parliament for Saint-Léonard—Saint-Michel Patricia Lattanzio will be in attendance.

Closed to media.

9:30 a.m. The Prime Minister, along with Member of Parliament for Saint-Léonard—Saint-Michel, Patricia Lattanzio, will visit a vaccination site.

Pôle de vaccination Saint-Michel
8333, 2e Avenue

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will make an announcement and hold a media availability. He will be joined by Premier of Quebec François Legault, Minister of Innovation, Science and Industry François-Philippe Champagne, Minister of Economic Development and Official Languages Mélanie Joly, Quebec’s Minister of Finance and Minister of Economy and Innovation Éric Girard, President and Chief Executive Officer of CAE Inc. Marc Parent, President of Pratt & Whitney Canada Maria Della Posta, and President of Bell Textron Canada Ltd. Steeve Lavoie.

Palais des congrès de Montréal
1001, place Jean-Paul-Riopelle

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 12:00 p.m. to room 220B.

Ottawa, Ontario

The Prime Minister will host a call with provincial and territorial premiers.

Closed to media.

Media appearances 

7:50 a.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air on 98.5 FM Montréal.

5:30 p.m. An interview with the Prime Minister will air on LCN and TVA Nouvelles.
